notEnoughChars: You must enter at least @chars characters!
ariaNavigatedToSolution: Navigated to newly included sample solution after textarea.
ariaShowSolution: Show the solution. You will be provided with a sample solution.
ariaRetry: Retry the task. You can improve your previous answer if the author allowed that.
taskDescription:
Find the volume of the trapezoidal prism in the exercise above where the base and top have the following measurements: side <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>a</mi>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mn>5</mn>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mtext>cm</mtext>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">a = 5\,\text{cm}</annotation></semantics></math>, side <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>b</mi>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mn>12</mn>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mtext>cm</mtext>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">b = 12\,\text{cm}</annotation></semantics></math>, the slant lengths are each <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>12</mn>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mtext>cm</mtext>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">12\,\text{cm}</annotation></semantics></math>, and the height of the trapezoidal base =<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>10</mn>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mtext>cm</mtext>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">10\,\text{cm}</annotation></semantics></math>. The height or length of the three-dimensional solid is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>24</mn>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mtext>cm</mtext>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">24\,\text{cm}</annotation></semantics></math>.
